{{Infobox football biography | name = Jason Lokilo | fullname = Jason Eyenga Lokilo{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=24 March 2018}} | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=y|1998|9|17}}{{cite web |title=Jason Eyenga-Lokilo |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/jason-eyenga-lokilo-256056/|publisher=11v11 |accessdate=22 August 2017}} | birth_place = [[Brussels]], Belgium | height = 1.75m | position = [[Midfielder (association football)#Winger|Winger]] | currentclub = [[FC Lorient|Lorient]]
(on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]) | clubnumber = 21https://m.lfp.fr/joueur/eyenga-lokilo-jason | youthclubs1 = [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] | youthyears1 = 2007–2014 | youthclubs2 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | youthyears2 = 2015–2017 | clubs1 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | years1 = 2017– | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2018– | clubs2 = → [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] (loan) | caps2 = 4 | goals2 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2015 | nationalteam1 = [[DR Congo national under-20 football team|DR Congo U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 21:47, 22 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 5 March 2017 }} '''Jason Eyenga Lokilo''' (born 17 September 1998) is a Congolese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for [[Ligue 2]] side [[FC Lorient]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]. ==Early life== Lokilo was born in [[Brussels]], Belgium on 17 September 1998. ==Playing career== Lokilo was a member of the [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] academy between 2007 and 2014.{{cite news|title=Securing investments in youth training: the Lokilo case|url=http://crestafirm.com/2017/07/11/securing-investments-youth-training-lokilo-case/|accessdate=23 August 2017|work=Football Legal}} He signed for [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 29 July 2015,{{cite news|title=Crystal Palace sign Belgian teen star Jason Lokilo from Anderlecht|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3254965/Crystal-Palace-sign-Belgian-teen-star-Jason-Lokilo-Anderlecht.html|accessdate=23 August 2017|publisher=Daily Mail}} spending the following two seasons playing for their youth teams. Following a number of appearances for the first team in pre-season games, Lokilo made his senior debut for Crystal Palace on 22 August 2017 against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] in the [[EFL Cup]].{{cite news|title=James McArthur brace hands Frank de Boer first Eagles win|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/crystal-palace-2-ipswich-town-1-james-mcarthur-brace-hands-frank-de-boer-first-eagles-win-a3617751.html|accessdate=23 August 2017|work=Evening Standard}} In August 2018, he joined French club [[FC Lorient]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/august/lokilo-joins-lorient-on-loan/|title=Lokilo Joins Lorient on Loan|access-date=2018-09-19|language=en-gb}} ==International career== Lokilo was born in Belgium and is of Congolese descent.{{cite web|url=http://www.adiac-congo.com/content/football-des-jeunes-la-rdc-u20-joue-en-amical-contre-langleterre-junior-39481|title=Football des jeunes : la RDC U20 joue en amical contre l’Angleterre junior - adiac-congo.com : toute l'actualité du Bassin du Congo|website=www.adiac-congo.com}} Lokilo debuted for the [[DR Congo national under-20 football team|DR Congo U20]] in an 8–0 friendly loss to the [[England national under-17 football team|England U17s]] on 7 October 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2015/oct/07/england-u17s-v-congo-dr-st-georges-park-match-report-071015|title=England U17s hit eight in World Cup warm-up with DR Congo|first=The Football|last=Association|website=www.thefa.com}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 15 February 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|[[FA Cup]] !colspan="2"|[[Football League Cup|League Cup]] !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |[[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] |[[2017–18 Crystal Palace F.C. season|2017–18]] |Premier League |0||0||0||0||1||0||1||0 |-
